intro: Impatiens radiata var. graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, erect capsules that contain its seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its aesthetic appeal.
